oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written in a professional taʻlīq script in black ink, rubricated in red, 20 lines per page in 4 gold-ruled columns. Contains 115 miniatures portraying various scenes from the poem.

Written by the professional calligrapher Khalīl Allāh Haftʻqalamī probably in Lahore in 1131-1134 [1718-1722] (ff. 1r, 201v, 203r, 403r). Last miniature is signed by ʻAbd al-Salām and ʻAbd al-Karīm, residents of Kashmīr, Rajab 1134 [1722] (f. 398v).
The ms is prepared for Sayyidʻzādah ʻIṣmat Allāh Khān (f. 201r).
Bound in brown leather with onlays and tooling, gilt, rebacked.
MS Persian 78. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
